99355.name: Disposable income inequality, Gini coefficient
99355.s_name: Fochesato and Bowles (2013 and 2017), Wang and Caminada (2011), OECD

source.name: Fochesato and Bowles (2013 and 2017), Wang and Caminada (2011), OECD
source.dataPublishedBy: Mattia Fochesato and Samuel Bowles. 2013. ‘Wealth Inequality from Prehistory to the Present: Data, Sources and Methods.’ Dynamics of Wealth Inequality Project, Behavioral Sciences Program, Santa Fe Institute; Mattia Fochesato and Samuel Bowles. 2017. ‘Technology, Institutions and Wealth Inequality in the Very Long Run’. Santa Fe Institute; Chen Wang and Koen Caminada. 2011. ‘Leiden Budget Incidence Fiscal Redistribution Dataset’. Version 1. Leiden Department of Economics Research; OECD Stat
source.additionalInfo: The gini coefficients for wealth inequality are for 2000 for the US and Sweden and 2003 for Japan. The gini coefficients for earnings and disposable income inequality are for 2004 for the US, 2005 for Sweden and 2006 for Japan. All the ginis for wealth inequality are from the Bowles and Fochesato database. The US and Swedish ginis for earnings and disposable income inequality are from the Leiden Budget Incidence Fiscal Redistribution Database, and the Japanese ginis for earnings and disposable income inequality are from the OECD.
